channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large pothole adjecent to traffic islan, 26th February
item.description:
This pothole is on Victoria Rd N9 northbound at a traffic island just after the junction with Chalfont Rd and just before the Hyde Arms pub. The pothole has been there for 4 weeks with no marking around it or any attempt to repair it. It is unavoidableand dangerous to all road users as it's near a traffic island and will damage motor vehicles and bicycles.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Chalfont Road, Edmonton
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crystal Palace Park Road, Crystal Palace, Greater London

item.title: In the middle of the road at the junction, 26th February
item.description:
It looks like some water main damage is causing so many potholes to appear in the road. Really hard to avoid on a bike as I go through daily. It’s been dry but looks lukewarm water is seeping out of the road. It could be very serious.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Kentish Town Road, Kentish Town, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Crystal Palace Parade, SE19 1UA at the end of number 1, 26th February
item.description:
Crystal Palace Parade, SE19 1UA at the end of number 10 – 11 (Cafe Paradou) (yes this is on the Lambeth side of the boundary with Southwark) at right hand end of frontage on white painted concrete rendered wall under advert wall tagged. Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor for reporting pin, & Google Streetview link: https://www.google.com/ maps/ @51.4206056,-0.0783686,3a,22.1y,262.54h,85.06t/ data=!3m8!1e1!3m6!1sj2IWrIjITuUM_8T5kVfPxg!2e0!5s20250501T000000!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D4.938397375944518%26panoid%3Dj2IWrIjITuUM_8T5kVfPxg%26yaw%3D262.53642875602077!7i16384!8i8192?authuser=0&entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI2MDEwNC4wIKXMDSoKLDEwMDc5MjA2N0gBUAM%3D
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10-11, Crystal Palace Parade, Crystal Palace, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Crystal Palace Parade SE19 about ten yards north, 26th February
item.description:
Crystal Palace Parade SE19 about ten yards north from streetlight ID number C115#1 is grey box (type normally controls traffic lights) which is tagged – see Google Streetview which shows streetlight and said box (although in view box is black): https://www.google.com/ maps/ @51.4201228,-0.0783373,3a,43y,80.47h,83.68t/ data=!3m7!1e1!3m5!1sMUv42Akasfx1dvoXfF-ghg!2e0!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D6.318837412093828%26panoid%3DMUv42Akasfx1dvoXfF-ghg%26yaw%3D80.47469721619856!7i16384!8i8192?entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI2MDEyMC4wIKXMDSoKLDEwMDc5MjA2N0gBUAM%3D

item.title: Multiple street lights out it’s very dark, 26th February
item.description:
At least five perhaps more street lights are out of action on both sides of peckham rye east side from Somerton Road/waveney Avenue up to Colyton Road. It is very dark walking along Peckham rye east and now feels very unsafe. Photos are of some of the lights but there are more.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Peckham Rye, Nunhead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
